intro: Hypochaeris minima, commonly known as the small yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features small, bright yellow flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Hypochaeris minima is often found in disturbed soils, meadows, and along roadsides, and it can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
